thread.title: Hotshots’ families at odds with Phoenix nonprofit over funds
thread.title_full: Hotshots’ families at odds with Phoenix nonprofit over funds | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Associated Press
title: Hotshots’ families at odds with Phoenix nonprofit over funds
text:
PHOENIX — Families of 19 fallen firefighters in north-central Arizona say they haven’t seen money raised in their name by a Phoenix nonprofit organization.
The Arizona Republic reports ( http://bit.ly/1QpjpTE) that Prescott Firefighter Charities now is asking the Arizona Foundation for Charitable Support to stop using the Granite Mountain Hotshots’ logo.
The foundation hasn’t distributed funds from a 2014 golf tournament held in Prescott and a similar event held at a Scottsdale course last month.
The events’ organizer says he welcomes requests from the surviving families for the money that was raised.
However, the non-profit has less than $2,000 to distribute because the two golf tournaments combined didn’t cover much more than their expenses after failing to attract major sponsors.
The 19 firefighters were killed while battling a June 2013 wildfire in Yarnell.
___
Information from: The Arizona Republic, http://www.azcentral.com
